intro: Crassula swaziensis, commonly known as the Swazi Crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves that help it survive in arid conditions. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the warmer months. Due to its hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
